etymology.description: 田(田) (tián, "field") + 甫(甫) (fǔ, "man") = field full of a man’s crop -> abundance
etymology.interpretation: 畐(畐) (fú, "abundance") combines a field with a man, symbolizing a field that produces sufficient crops to sustain a person, denoting abundance.

examples.chinese: 秋收时节(秋收時節)，田野畐盈(田野畐盈)。
examples.pinyin: Qiū shōu shí jié, Tián yě fú yíng.
examples.english: In the harvest season, the fields are abundantly full.

examples.chinese: 他心中畐满希望(他心中畐滿希望)。
examples.pinyin: Tā xīn zhōng fú mǎn xī wàng.
examples.english: He is filled with abundant hope in his heart.
